extendedIngredients.name: thyme
extendedIngredients.originalString: Hilary's Eat Well Balsamic Thyme Dressing with Eyebright or homemade balsamic vinaigrette, to taste
metaInformation: with eyebright or homemade balsamic vinaigrette, to taste

recipes.title: Simple Beet, Arugula and Feta Salad with Hilary’s Balsamic Thyme Dressing

winePairing.pairingText: Salad works really well with Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. You could try Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 35 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Aromas of apricot, guava and pineapple juice mingle with hints of sweet vanilla and warm toasty notes.

recipes.instructions: First, toast the pepitas in a skillet over medium heat until fragrant and making little popping noises, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl to cool.Peel the rough skin from the beets with a vegetable peeler. If you have a mandoline, use it to slice the beets into thin matchsticks (watch your fingers!). If you don't have a mandoline, hold onto the rough end of the beet and slice the beet into super thin rounds, starting at the tip and working your way to the rough top. Discard the rough top. Working in batches, stack the rounds on top of each other and slice them into long, thin matchsticks.In a medium-sized serving bowl, combine the beets, arugula, crumbled feta and pepitas. Drizzle in just enough dressing to lightly coat the salad once tossed. Toss and serve.

steps.step: First, toast the pepitas in a skillet over medium heat until fragrant and making little popping noises, about 5 minutes.

Transfer to a bowl to cool.Peel the rough skin from the beets with a vegetable peeler. If you have a mandoline, use it to slice the beets into thin matchsticks (watch your fingers!). If you don't have a mandoline, hold onto the rough end of the beet and slice the beet into super thin rounds, starting at the tip and working your way to the rough top. Discard the rough top. Working in batches, stack the rounds on top of each other and slice them into long, thin matchsticks.In a medium-sized serving bowl, combine the beets, arugula, crumbled feta and pepitas.
Drizzle in just enough dressing to lightly coat the salad once tossed. Toss and serve.
